meta.hint:
A noun is a word that names a person, place, or thing.
A common noun names a general type of person, place, or thing. A common noun does not begin with a capital letter, except when it is the first word in a sentence.
A proper noun names a specific person, place, or thing. A proper noun always begins with a capital letter.
Common Nouns Proper Nouns Boy Jacob Day Tuesday Street Elm Street City Mumbai
meta.question: Identify whether the noun in bold  is a common or proper noun.

content.description: We were mesmerized seeing the beauty of Taj Mahal.
